intro: Sedum sanctae-monicae, commonly known as the sacred Monica's sedum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing pale yellow to orange flowers. Sedum sanctae-monicae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
